member.name: M:Dalamud.Console.ConsoleManager.GetCommandParsingRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
("[^"]+"|[^\\s"]+)
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
○ 1st capture group.
○ Match with 2 alternative expressions, atomically.
○ Match a sequence of expressions.
○ Match '"'.
○ Match a character other than '"' atomically at least once.
○ Match '"'.
○ Match a character in the set [^"\s] atomically at least once.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.Conditions.ConditionFlag
member.summary:
Possible state flags (or conditions as they're called internally) that can be set on the local client.
These come from LogMessage (somewhere) and directly map to each state field managed by the client. As of 5.25, it maps to LogMessage row 7700 and onwards, which can be checked by looking at the Condition sheet and looking at what column 2 maps to.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadInput
member.summary:
Struct which gets populated by polling the gamepads.
Has an array of gamepads, among many other things (here not mapped). All we really care about is the final data which the game uses to determine input.
The size is definitely bigger than only the following fields but I do not know how big.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadInput.LeftStickX
member.summary: Left analogue stick's horizontal value, -99 for left, 99 for right.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadInput.LeftStickY
member.summary: Left analogue stick's vertical value, -99 for down, 99 for up.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadInput.RightStickX
member.summary: Right analogue stick's horizontal value, -99 for left, 99 for right.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadInput.RightStickY
member.summary: Right analogue stick's vertical value, -99 for down, 99 for up.

member.remarks: This is a bitfield.

member.summary: Button pressed, set once when the button is pressed. See for the mapping.
member.remarks: This is a bitfield.

member.summary: Button released input, set once right after the button is not hold anymore. See for the mapping.
member.remarks: This is a bitfield.

member.summary: Repeatedly emits the held button input in fixed intervals. See for the mapping.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadState.NavEnableGamepad
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether detour should block gamepad input for game.
Ideally, we would use (ImGui.GetIO().ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags.NavEnableGamepad) > 0 but this has a race condition during load with the detour which sets up ImGui and throws if our detour gets called before the other.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.Keys.KeyState
member.summary: Wrapper around the game keystate buffer, which contains the pressed state for all keyboard keys, indexed by virtual vkCode.
member.remarks: The stored key state is actually a combination field, however the below ephemeral states are consumed each frame. Setting the value may be mildly useful, however retrieving the value is largely pointless. In testing, it wasn't possible without setting the statue manually. index & 0 = key pressed. index & 1 = key down (ephemeral). index & 2 = key up (ephemeral). index & 3 = short key press (ephemeral).

member.summary:
Gets the GameObjectID for this GameObject. The Game Object ID is a globally unique identifier that points to this specific object. This ID is used to reference specific objects on the local client (e.g. for targeting).
Not to be confused with .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.Objects.Types.IGameObject.EntityId
member.summary:
Gets the Entity ID for this GameObject. Entity IDs are assigned to networked GameObjects.
A value of 0xE000_0000 indicates that this entity is not networked and has specific interactivity rules.

member.remarks: It may seem backwards that an upload only performs a delete request, however this is not trying to track the available listings, that is done via the listings packet. All this does is remove a listing, or delete it, when a purchase has been made.

member.summary: Scan memory for a signature.

The amount of bytes to scan.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.SigScanner.TryScan(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.String,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Try scanning memory for a signature.

The amount of bytes to scan.
member.returns: true if the signature was found.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.SigScanner.GetStaticAddressFromSig(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Scan for a .data address using a .text function. This is intended to be used with IDA sigs. Place your cursor on the line calling a static address, and create and IDA sig. The signature and offset should not break through instruction boundaries.
member.param: The signature of the function using the data.
The offset from function start of the instruction using the data.
member.returns: An IntPtr to the static memory location.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.SigScanner.TryGetStaticAddressFromSig(System.String,System.IntPtr@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Try scanning for a .data address using a .text function. This is intended to be used with IDA sigs. Place your cursor on the line calling a static address, and create and IDA sig.
member.param: The signature of the function using the data.
An IntPtr to the static memory location, if found.
The offset from function start of the instruction using the data.
member.returns: true if the signature was found.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.SigScanner.Save
member.summary: Save the current state of the cache.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.SigScanner.DisposeCore

member.summary: The [あ] character indicating that the Japanese IME is in full-width Hiragana input mode.
member.remarks: Half-width Hiragana exists as a Windows API constant, but the feature is unused, or at least unexposed to the end user via the IME.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.CallHook`1
member.summary:
This class represents a callsite hook. Only the specific address's instructions are replaced with this hook. This is a destructive operation, no other callsite hooks can coexist at the same address.
There's no .Original for this hook type. This is only intended for be for functions where the parameters provided allow you to invoke the original call.
This class was specifically added for hooking virtual function callsites. Only the specific callsite hooked is modified, if the game calls the virtual function from other locations this hook will not be triggered.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker
member.summary: A class which stores a copy of the bytes at a location which will be hooked in the future, such that those bytes can be restored later to "unhook" the function.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Upon creation, the Unhooker stores a copy of the bytes stored at the provided address, and can be used to restore these bytes when the hook should be removed. As such this class should be instantiated before the function is actually hooked.
member.param: The address which will be hooked.
The minimum amount of bytes to restore when unhooking.
The maximum amount of bytes to restore when unhooking.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker.TrimAfterHook
member.summary: When called after a hook is created, checks the pre-hook original bytes and post-hook modified bytes, trimming the original bytes stored and removing unmodified bytes from the end of the byte sequence. Assuming no concurrent actions modified the same address space, this should result in storing only the minimum bytes required to unhook the function.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker.Unhook
member.summary: Attempts to unhook the function by replacing the hooked bytes with the original bytes. If was called, the trimmed original bytes stored at that time will be used for unhooking. Otherwise, a naive algorithm which only restores bytes until the first unchanged byte will be used in order to avoid overwriting adjacent data.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager
member.summary: Implements interop enums and function calls to interact with external drag and drop.
A manager that keeps state of external windows drag and drop events, and can be used to create ImGui drag and drop sources and targets for those external events.
Implements the IDropTarget interface to interact with external drag and dropping.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.ServiceAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether external drag and drop is available at all.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.IsDragging
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a valid external drag and drop is currently active and hovering over any FFXIV-related viewport.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.HasPaths
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there are any files or directories currently being dragged, or stored from the last drop.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.Files
member.summary: Gets the list of file paths currently being dragged from an external application over any FFXIV-related viewport, or stored from the last drop.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.Extensions
member.summary: Gets a set of all extensions available in the paths currently being dragged from an external application over any FFXIV-related viewport or stored from the last drop.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.Directories
member.summary: Gets the list of directory paths currently being dragged from an external application over any FFXIV-related viewport or stored from the last drop.

member.summary: Enable external drag and drop.

member.summary: Disable external drag and drop.

member.summary: Invoked whenever a drag and drop process drags files into any FFXIV-related viewport.
member.param: The mouse button used to drag as well as key modifiers.
Effects that can be used with this drag and drop process.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.DragOver(System.UInt32,Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.POINTL,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Invoked every windows update-frame as long as the drag and drop process keeps hovering over an FFXIV-related viewport.
member.param: The mouse button used to drag as well as key modifiers.
Effects that can be used with this drag and drop process.
member.remarks: Can be invoked more often than once a XIV frame, so we are keeping track of frames to skip unnecessary updates.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.DragLeave
member.summary: Invoked whenever a drag and drop process that hovered over any FFXIV-related viewport leaves all FFXIV-related viewports.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.Drop(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject,System.UInt32,Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.POINTL,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Invoked whenever a drag process ends by dropping over any FFXIV-related viewport.
member.param: The mouse button used to drag as well as key modifiers.
Effects that can be used with this drag and drop process.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager
member.summary: A service to handle external drag and drop from WinAPI.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.ServiceAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Drag and Drop functionality is available at all.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.IsDragging
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether anything is being dragged from an external application and over any of the games viewports.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.Files
member.summary: Gets the list of files currently being dragged from an external application over any of the games viewports.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.Extensions
member.summary: Gets the set of file types by extension currently being dragged from an external application over any of the games viewports.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.Directories
member.summary: Gets the list of directories currently being dragged from an external application over any of the games viewports.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.CreateImGuiSource(System.String,System.Func{Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Create an ImGui drag and drop source that is active only if anything is being dragged from an external source.
member.param: The label used for the drag and drop payload.
A function returning whether the current status is relevant for this source. Checked before creating the source but only if something is being dragged.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.CreateImGuiSource(System.String,System.Func{Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager,System.Boolean},System.Func{Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Create an ImGui drag and drop source that is active only if anything is being dragged from an external source.
member.param: The label used for the drag and drop payload.
A function returning whether the current status is relevant for this source. Checked before creating the source but only if something is being dragged.

Executes ImGui functions to build a tooltip. Should return true if it creates any tooltip and false otherwise. If multiple sources are active, only the first non-empty tooltip type drawn in a frame will be used.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.CreateImGuiTarget(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String}@,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String}@)
member.summary: Create an ImGui drag and drop target on the last ImGui object.
member.param: The label used for the drag and drop payload.
On success, contains the list of file paths dropped onto the target.
On success, contains the list of directory paths dropped onto the target.
member.returns: True if items were dropped onto the target this frame, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.IActiveNotification.SetIconTexture(Dalamud.Interface.Textures.TextureWraps.IDalamudTextureWrap)
member.summary: Sets the icon from , overriding the icon.
member.param: The new texture wrap to use, or null to clear and revert back to the icon specified from .

remarks.para: The texture passed will be disposed when the notification is dismissed or a new different texture is set via another call to this function or overwriting the property. You do not have to dispose it yourself.
If is not null, then calling this function will simply dispose the passed without actually updating the icon.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.IActiveNotification.SetIconTexture(System.Threading.Tasks.Task{Dalamud.Interface.Textures.TextureWraps.IDalamudTextureWrap})
member.summary: Sets the icon from , overriding the icon, once the given task completes.
member.param: The task that will result in a new texture wrap to use, or null to clear and revert back to the icon specified from .

remarks.para: The texture resulted from the passed will be disposed when the notification is dismissed or a new different texture is set via another call to this function over overwriting the property. You do not have to dispose the resulted instance of yourself.
If the task fails for any reason, the exception will be silently ignored and the icon specified from will be used instead.
If is not null, then calling this function will simply dispose the result of the passed without actually updating the icon.

remarks.para: If is false, the texture passed will be disposed when the notification is dismissed or a new different texture is set via another call to this function. You do not have to dispose it yourself.
If is not null and is false, then calling this function will simply dispose the passed without actually updating the icon.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.IconTexture
member.summary: Gets or sets a texture wrap that will be used in place of if set.

remarks.para: A texture wrap set via this property will NOT be disposed when the notification is dismissed. Use or to use a texture, after calling . Call either of those functions with null to revert the effective icon back to this property.

This property and are bound together. If the task is not null but is false (because the task is still in progress or faulted,) the property will return null. Setting this property will set to a new completed with the new value as its result.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.IconTextureTask
member.summary: Gets or sets a task that results in a texture wrap that will be used in place of if available.

remarks.para: A texture wrap set via this property will NOT be disposed when the notification is dismissed. Use or to use a texture, after calling . Call either of those functions with null to revert the effective icon back to this property.
This property and are bound together.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.HardExpiry
member.summary: Gets or sets the hard expiry.
member.remarks:
Setting this value will override and , in that the notification will be dismissed when this expiry expires.
Set to to make only take effect.
If both and are MaxValue, then the notification will not expire after a set time. It must be explicitly dismissed by the user or via calling .
Updating this value will reset the dismiss timer.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.InitialDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial duration.
member.remarks: Set to to make only take effect.
Updating this value will reset the dismiss timer, but the remaining duration will still be calculated based on .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.ExtensionDurationSinceLastInterest
member.summary: Gets or sets the new duration for this notification once the mouse cursor leaves the window and the window is no longer focused.
member.remarks:
If set to or less, then this feature is turned off, and hovering the mouse on the notification or focusing on it will not make the notification stay.
Updating this value will reset the dismiss timer.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotificationIcon
member.summary: Icon source for .
member.remarks: Plugins implementing this interface are left to their own on managing the resources contained by the instance of their implementation of . In other words, they should not expect to have called if their implementation is an . Dalamud will not call on any instance of . On plugin unloads, the icon may be reverted back to the default, if the instance of is not provided by Dalamud.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.Internal.ActiveNotification.RemoveNonDalamudInvocations
member.summary: Removes non-Dalamud invocation targets from events.
member.remarks: This is done to prevent references of plugins being unloaded from outliving the plugin itself. Anything that can contain plugin-provided types and functions count, which effectively means that events and interface/object-typed fields need to be scrubbed. As a notification can be marked as non-user-dismissable, in which case after removing event handlers there will be no way to remove the notification, we force the notification to become user-dismissable, and reset the expiry to the default duration on unload.

member.summary: Updates the state of this notification, and release the relevant resource if this notification is no longer in use.
member.returns: true if the notification is over and relevant resources are released.
member.remarks: Intended to be called from the main thread only.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.Internal.ImGuiClipboardFunctionProvider
member.summary: Configures the ImGui clipboard behaviour to work nicely with XIV.

remarks.para: XIV uses '\r' for line endings and will truncate all text after a '\n' character. This means that copy/pasting multi-line text from ImGui to XIV will only copy the first line.
ImGui uses '\n' for line endings and will ignore '\r' entirely. This means that copy/pasting multi-line text from XIV to ImGui will copy all the text without line breaks.
To fix this we normalize all clipboard line endings entering/exiting ImGui to '\r\n' which works for both ImGui and XIV.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.Internal.ImGuiDrawListFixProvider
member.summary:
Fixes ImDrawList not correctly dealing with the current texture for that draw list not in tune with the global state. Currently, ImDrawList::AddPolyLine and ImDrawList::AddRectFilled are affected.
* The implementation for AddRectFilled is entirely replaced with the hook below. * The implementation for AddPolyLine is wrapped with Push/PopTextureID.
TODO: * imgui_draw.cpp:1433 ImDrawList::AddRectFilled The if block needs a PushTextureID(_Data->TexIdCommon)/PopTextureID() block, if _Data->TexIdCommon != _CmdHeader.TextureId. * imgui_draw.cpp:729 ImDrawList::AddPolyLine The if block always needs to call PushTextureID if the abovementioned condition is not met. Change push_texture_id to only have one condition.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode
member.summary: Specifies how should global font scale affect a font.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode.Default
member.summary: Do the default handling. Dalamud will load the sufficienty large font that will accomodate the global scale, and stretch the loaded glyphs so that they look pixel-perfect after applying global scale on drawing. Note that bitmap fonts and game fonts will always look blurry if they're not in their original sizes.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode.SkipHandling
member.summary: Do nothing with the font. Dalamud will load the font with the size that is exactly as specified. On drawing, the font will look blurry due to stretching. Intended for use with custom scale handling.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode.UndoGlobalScale
member.summary: Stretch the glyphs of the loaded font by the inverse of the global scale. On drawing, the font will always render exactly as the requested size without blurring, as long as and do not affect the scale any further. Note that bitmap fonts and game fonts will always look blurry if they're not in their original sizes.

remarks.para: Consider calling to support glyphs that are not supplied by the game by default; this mostly affects Chinese and Korean language users.

member.summary: The raw config.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct, copying applicable values from an existing instance of .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.FontNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of font within a TTF/OTF file.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.SizePx
member.summary:
Gets or sets the desired size of the new font, in pixels.
Effectively, this is the line height.
Value is tied with .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.SizePt
member.summary:
Gets or sets the desired size of the new font, in points.
Effectively, this is the line height.
Value is tied with .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.OversampleH
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal oversampling pixel count.
Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning.
Note the difference between 2 and 3 is minimal so you can reduce this to 2 to save memory.
Read https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/tests/oversample/README.md for details.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.OversampleV
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical oversampling pixel count.
Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning.
This is not really useful as we don't use sub-pixel positions on the Y axis.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.PixelSnapH
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to align every glyph to pixel boundary.
Useful e.g. if you are merging a non-pixel aligned font with the default font.
If enabled, you can set and to 1.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphExtraSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the extra spacing (in pixels) between glyphs.
Only X axis is supported for now.
Effectively, it is the letter spacing.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the offset all glyphs from this font input.
Use this to offset fonts vertically when merging multiple fonts.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphRanges
member.summary:
Gets or sets the glyph ranges, which is a user-provided list of Unicode range. Each range has 2 values, and values are inclusive.
The list must be zero-terminated.
If empty or null, then all the glyphs from the font that is in the range of UCS-2 will be added.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphMinAdvanceX
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum AdvanceX for glyphs.
Set only to align font icons.
Set both / to enforce mono-space font.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphMaxAdvanceX
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum AdvanceX for glyphs.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.RasterizerMultiply
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that either brightens (>1.0f) or darkens (<1.0f) the font output.
Brightening small fonts may be a good workaround to make them more readable.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.RasterizerGamma
member.summary: Gets or sets the gamma value for fonts.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.EllipsisChar
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value explicitly specifying unicode codepoint of the ellipsis character.
When fonts are being merged first specified ellipsis will be used.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired name of the new font. Names longer than 40 bytes will be partially lost.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.MergeFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired font to merge with, if set.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.ThrowOnInvalidValues
member.summary: Throws with appropriate messages, if this has invalid values.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.Textures.ISharedImmediateTexture
member.summary: A texture with a backing instance of that is shared across multiple requesters.

remarks.para: Calling on this interface is a no-op.
and may stop returning the intended texture at any point. Use to lock the texture for use in any thread for any duration.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.Textures.ISharedImmediateTexture.GetWrapOrEmpty
member.summary: Gets the texture for use with the current frame, or an empty texture if unavailable.
member.returns: An instance of that is guaranteed to be available for the current frame being drawn.

remarks.para: Do not cache the result of this function across draw calls for different frames. s may be cached, but the performance benefit will be minimal.
Calling outside the main thread will fail.
This function does not throw.
will be ignored.
If the texture is unavailable for any reason, then the returned instance of will point to an empty texture instead.

member.param: The default wrap to return if the requested texture was not immediately available.
member.returns: An instance of that is guaranteed to be available for the current frame being drawn.

remarks.para: Do not cache the result of this function across draw calls for different frames. s may be cached, but the performance benefit will be minimal.
Calling outside the main thread will fail.
This function does not throw.
will be ignored.
If the texture is unavailable for any reason, then will be returned.

This function does not throw.
on the returned will be ignored.

member.exception: Thrown when called outside the UI thread.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.Textures.ISharedImmediateTexture.RentAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)

summary.para: Creates a new instance of holding a new reference to this texture. The returned texture is guaranteed to be available until is called.

WARNING! Usually, this method should be a "last resort"/compatibility wrapper for old code that does not directly support directly. Prefer using any of the other methods if possible, and DO NOT CACHE the resulting texture wrap from those functions.

member.returns: A containing the loaded texture on success.
member.remarks: must be called on the resulting instance of from the returned after use. Consider using to dispose the result automatically according to the state of the task.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.Textures.TextureWraps.IDalamudTextureWrap.CreateWrapSharingLowLevelResource
member.summary: Creates a new reference to the resource being pointed by this instance of .
member.returns: The new reference to this texture wrap.
member.remarks:
On calling this function, a new instance of will be returned, but with the same . The new instance must be d, as the backing resource will stay alive until all the references are released. The old instance may be disposed as needed, once this function returns; the new instance will stay alive regardless of whether the old instance has been disposed.
Primary purpose of this function is to share textures across plugin boundaries. When texture wraps get passed across plugin boundaries for use for an indeterminate duration, the receiver should call this function to obtain a new reference to the texture received, so that it gets its own "copy" of the texture and the caller may dispose the texture anytime without any care for the receiver.
The default implementation will treat as an .

member.name: T:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection
member.summary: PAGE_* from memoryapi.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.Execute
member.summary: Enables execute access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation. This flag is not supported by the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ExecuteRead
member.summary: Enables execute or read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ExecuteReadWrite
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or read/write access to the committed region of pages.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ExecuteWriteCopy
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE, and the change is written to the new page. This flag is not supported by the VirtualAlloc or VirtualAllocEx functions.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.NoAccess
member.summary: Disables all access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to read from, write to, or execute the committed region results in an access violation. This flag is not supported by the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ReadOnly
member.summary: Enables read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, an attempt to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ReadWrite
member.summary: Enables read-only or read/write access to the committed region of pages. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.WriteCopy
member.summary: Enables read-only or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as PAGE_READWRITE, and the change is written to the new page. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation. This flag is not supported by the VirtualAlloc or VirtualAllocEx functions.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.TargetsInvalid
member.summary: Sets all locations in the pages as invalid targets for CFG. Used along with any execute page protection like PAGE_EXECUTE, PAGE_EXECUTE_READ, PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE and PAGE_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY. Any indirect call to locations in those pages will fail CFG checks and the process will be terminated. The default behavior for executable pages allocated is to be marked valid call targets for CFG. This flag is not supported by the VirtualProtect or CreateFileMapping functions.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.TargetsNoUpdate
member.summary: Pages in the region will not have their CFG information updated while the protection changes for VirtualProtect. For example, if the pages in the region was allocated using PAGE_TARGETS_INVALID, then the invalid information will be maintained while the page protection changes. This flag is only valid when the protection changes to an executable type like PAGE_EXECUTE, PAGE_EXECUTE_READ, PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE and PAGE_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY. The default behavior for VirtualProtect protection change to executable is to mark all locations as valid call targets for CFG.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.Guard
member.summary: Pages in the region become guard pages. Any attempt to access a guard page causes the system to raise a STATUS_GUARD_PAGE_VIOLATION exception and turn off the guard page status. Guard pages thus act as a one-time access alarm. For more information, see Creating Guard Pages. When an access attempt leads the system to turn off guard page status, the underlying page protection takes over. If a guard page exception occurs during a system service, the service typically returns a failure status indicator. This value cannot be used with PAGE_NOACCESS. This flag is not supported by the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.NoCache
member.summary: Sets all pages to be non-cachable. Applications should not use this attribute except when explicitly required for a device. Using the interlocked functions with memory that is mapped with SEC_NOCACHE can result in an EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION exception. The PAGE_NOCACHE flag cannot be used with the PAGE_GUARD, PAGE_NOACCESS, or PAGE_WRITECOMBINE flags. The PAGE_NOCACHE flag can be used only when allocating private memory with the VirtualAlloc, VirtualAllocEx, or VirtualAllocExNuma functions. To enable non-cached memory access for shared memory, specify the SEC_NOCACHE flag when calling the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.WriteCombine
member.summary: Sets all pages to be write-combined. Applications should not use this attribute except when explicitly required for a device. Using the interlocked functions with memory that is mapped as write-combined can result in an EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION exception. The PAGE_WRITECOMBINE flag cannot be specified with the PAGE_NOACCESS, PAGE_GUARD, and PAGE_NOCACHE flags. The PAGE_WRITECOMBINE flag can be used only when allocating private memory with the VirtualAlloc, VirtualAllocEx, or VirtualAllocExNuma functions. To enable write-combined memory access for shared memory, specify the SEC_WRITECOMBINE flag when calling the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.Ok
member.summary: The message box contains one push button: OK. This is the default.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.OkCancel
member.summary: The message box contains two push buttons: OK and Cancel.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.RetryCancel

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.YesNo
member.summary: The message box contains two push buttons: Yes and No.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.YesNoCancel
member.summary: The message box contains three push buttons: Yes, No, and Cancel.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconExclamation
member.summary: An exclamation-point icon appears in the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconWarning
member.summary: An exclamation-point icon appears in the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconInformation
member.summary: An icon consisting of a lowercase letter i in a circle appears in the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconAsterisk
member.summary: An icon consisting of a lowercase letter i in a circle appears in the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconQuestion
member.summary: A question-mark icon appears in the message box. The question-mark message icon is no longer recommended because it does not clearly represent a specific type of message and because the phrasing of a message as a question could apply to any message type. In addition, users can confuse the message symbol question mark with Help information. Therefore, do not use this question mark message symbol in your message boxes. The system continues to support its inclusion only for backward compatibility.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconStop
member.summary: A stop-sign icon appears in the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconError
member.summary: A stop-sign icon appears in the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.IconHand
member.summary: A stop-sign icon appears in the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.DefButton1
member.summary: The first button is the default button. MB_DEFBUTTON1 is the default unless MB_DEFBUTTON2, MB_DEFBUTTON3, or MB_DEFBUTTON4 is specified.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.DefButton2
member.summary: The second button is the default button.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.DefButton3
member.summary: The third button is the default button.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.DefButton4
member.summary: The fourth button is the default button.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.ApplModal
member.summary: The user must respond to the message box before continuing work in the window identified by the hWnd parameter. However, the user can move to the windows of other threads and work in those windows. Depending on the hierarchy of windows in the application, the user may be able to move to other windows within the thread. All child windows of the parent of the message box are automatically disabled, but pop-up windows are not. MB_APPLMODAL is the default if neither MB_SYSTEMMODAL nor MB_TASKMODAL is specified.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.SystemModal
member.summary: Same as MB_APPLMODAL except that the message box has the WS_EX_TOPMOST style. Use system-modal message boxes to notify the user of serious, potentially damaging errors that require immediate attention (for example, running out of memory). This flag has no effect on the user's ability to interact with windows other than those associated with hWnd.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.TaskModal
member.summary: Same as MB_APPLMODAL except that all the top-level windows belonging to the current thread are disabled if the hWnd parameter is NULL. Use this flag when the calling application or library does not have a window handle available but still needs to prevent input to other windows in the calling thread without suspending other threads.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.DefaultDesktopOnly
member.summary: Same as desktop of the interactive window station. For more information, see Window Stations. If the current input desktop is not the default desktop, MessageBox does not return until the user switches to the default desktop.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.Right
member.summary: The text is right-justified.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.RtlReading
member.summary: Displays message and caption text using right-to-left reading order on Hebrew and Arabic systems.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.SetForeground
member.summary: The message box becomes the foreground window. Internally, the system calls the SetForegroundWindow function for the message box.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.Topmost
member.summary: The message box is created with the WS_EX_TOPMOST window style.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType.ServiceNotification
member.summary: The caller is a service notifying the user of an event. The function displays a message box on the current active desktop, even if there is no user logged on to the computer.

member.summary: Returns true if the current application has focus, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.CallWindowProcW(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Passes message information to the specified window procedure.
member.param: The previous window procedure. If this value is obtained by calling the GetWindowLong function with the nIndex parameter set to GWL_WNDPROC or DWL_DLGPROC, it is actually either the address of a window or dialog box procedure, or a special internal value meaningful only to CallWindowProc.
A handle to the window procedure to receive the message.
Additional message-specific information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of the Msg parameter.
More additional message-specific information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of the Msg parameter.
member.returns: Use the CallWindowProc function for window subclassing. Usually, all windows with the same class share one window procedure. A subclass is a window or set of windows with the same class whose messages are intercepted and processed by another window procedure (or procedures) before being passed to the window procedure of the class. The SetWindowLong function creates the subclass by changing the window procedure associated with a particular window, causing the system to call the new window procedure instead of the previous one.An application must pass any messages not processed by the new window procedure to the previous window procedure by calling CallWindowProc.This allows the application to create a chain of window procedures.

member.name: M:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.FlashWindowEx(Dalamud.NativeFunctions.FlashWindowInfo@)
member.summary: See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-flashwindowex. Flashes the specified window. It does not change the active state of the window.
member.param: A pointer to a FLASHWINFO structure.
member.returns: The return value specifies the window's state before the call to the FlashWindowEx function. If the window caption was drawn as active before the call, the return value is nonzero. Otherwise, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.GetForegroundWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.returns: The return value is a handle to the foreground window. The foreground window can be NULL in certain circumstances, such as when a window is losing activation.

member.name: M:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.GetWindowThreadProcessId(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the thread that created the specified window and, optionally, the identifier of the process that created the window.
member.param: A pointer to a variable that receives the process identifier. If this parameter is not NULL, GetWindowThreadProcessId copies the identifier of the process to the variable; otherwise, it does not.
member.returns: The return value is the identifier of the thread that created the window.

member.name: M:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxW(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,Dalamud.NativeFunctions.MessageBoxType)
member.summary: Displays a modal dialog box that contains a system icon, a set of buttons, and a brief application-specific message, such as status or error information. The message box returns an integer value that indicates which button the user clicked.
member.param: A handle to the owner window of the message box to be created. If this parameter is NULL, the message box has no owner window.
The message to be displayed. If the string consists of more than one line, you can separate the lines using a carriage return and/or linefeed character between each line.
The dialog box title. If this parameter is NULL, the default title is Error.
The contents and behavior of the dialog box. This parameter can be a combination of flags from the following groups of flags.
member.returns: If a message box has a Cancel button, the function returns the IDCANCEL value if either the ESC key is pressed or the Cancel button is selected. If the message box has no Cancel button, pressing ESC will no effect - unless an MB_OK button is present. If an MB_OK button is displayed and the user presses ESC, the return value will be IDOK. If the function fails, the return value is zero.To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If the function succeeds, the return value is one of the ID* enum values.

member.name: M:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.SetWindowLongPtrW(System.IntPtr,Dalamud.NativeFunctions.WindowLongType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes an attribute of the specified window. The function also sets a value at the specified offset in the extra window memory.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs. The SetWindowLongPtr function fails if the process that owns the window specified by the hWnd parameter is at a higher process privilege in the UIPI hierarchy than the process the calling thread resides in.

The zero-based offset to the value to be set. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus the size of a LONG_PTR. To set any other value, specify one of the values.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the previous value of the specified offset. If the function fails, the return value is zero.To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If the previous value is zero and the function succeeds, the return value is zero, but the function does not clear the last error information. To determine success or failure, clear the last error information by calling SetLastError with 0, then call SetWindowLongPtr.Function failure will be indicated by a return value of zero and a GetLastError result that is nonzero.

member.name: T:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.FlashWindowInfo
member.summary: See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-flashwinfo. Contains the flash status for a window and the number of times the system should flash the window.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.FlashWindowInfo.Hwnd
member.summary: A handle to the window to be flashed. The window can be either opened or minimized.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.FlashWindowInfo.Flags
member.summary: The flash status. This parameter can be one or more of the FlashWindow enum values.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.FlashWindowInfo.Count
member.summary: The number of times to flash the window.

member.name: F:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.FlashWindowInfo.Timeout
member.summary: The rate at which the window is to be flashed, in milliseconds. If dwTimeout is zero, the function uses the default cursor blink rate.

member.name: M:Dalamud.NativeFunctions.SystemParametersInfo(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the value of one of the system-wide parameters. This function can also update the user profile while setting a parameter.
member.param: The system-wide parameter to be retrieved or set.
A parameter whose usage and format depends on the system parameter being queried or set.
A parameter whose usage and format depends on the system parameter being queried or set. If not otherwise indicated, you must specify zero for this parameter.

If a system parameter is being set, specifies whether the user profile is to be updated, and if so, whether the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message is to be broadcast to all top-level windows to notify them of the change.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a nonzero value.

Size, in bytes, of the output buffer, even if the output is a Unicode string. The application sets this parameter to 0 if the function is to return the size of the required output buffer.

If dwBufLen is set to 0, the function returns the buffer size, in bytes, required to receive all requested information, excluding the terminating null character.
